title: Fifa will pay Seamus Coleman’s £50,000-a-week wages until the Everton star recovers from double leg break
text:
Comments FIFA will stump up Seamus Coleman’s wages whilst he recovers from his injury hell. 
The Ireland right-back is sidelined for at least six months after suffering a double leg break following a challenge by Neil Taylor in their 0-0 draw with Wales on Friday. PA:Press Association 3 Fifa will pay all of Seamus Coleman’s £50,000-a-week wages during his recovery 
The Everton star had successful surgery on Saturday and now faces a painful rehabilitation to get back to full fitness. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest Football news, gossip and rumours 
And Fifa’s club protection programme means they will pay the player’s wages, thought to be around £50,000-a-week, until he fully recovers. 
Everton have been keeping in close contract with doctors in Dublin and sent their own physiotherapist to check on his progress. 
He said: “He had the operation yesterday [Saturday] morning at 8:30am, that was successful. 
“He has realised everything that has happened and is obviously very disappointed. Meanwhile Nicola Rizzolo, who was officiating the match, has been slammed for his role in Coleman’s injury.
